Name: Round Lamp with Cross Ornament
Description: The round lamp's decoration is simple. It has an opening in which oil was poured on the right, in the direction of the Greek letter "Rho." Below the opening is an ornament in the form of a cross bordered by ridges. The wick opening is small and round with a raised ornament above it. The handle has a hole with ridges on the top. In Roman times, lamps were very simple without any decoration. Later, interest in lamp ornamentation increased.
